item.text: Josiah observed a Passover festival for the Lord in Jerusalem. They slaughtered the Passover lambs on the fourteenth day of the first month.
He appointed the priests to fulfill their duties and encouraged them to carry out their service in the Lord’s temple.

He told the Levites, who instructed all Israel about things consecrated to the Lord, “Place the holy ark in the temple which King Solomon son of David of Israel built. Don’t carry it on your shoulders. Now serve the Lord your God and his people Israel!

<st data-num="03559" class="">Prepare</st> yourselves by your <st data-num="01004 01">families</st> according to your <st data-num="04256" class="">divisions</st>, as <st data-num="03791" class="">instructed in writing</st> by <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="04385" class="">and</st> his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st>.

<st data-num="05975" class="">Stand</st> in the <st data-num="06944" class="">sanctuary</st> and, <st data-num="02515 01004 01">together with</st> the <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st>, represent the <st data-num="01004 01">family</st> <st data-num="06391" class="">divisions</st> of your <st data-num="0251 01121 05971">countrymen</st>.<n id="1" />
Slaughter the Passover lambs, consecrate yourselves, and make preparations for your countrymen to celebrate according to the Lord’s message which came through Moses.”
From his own royal flocks and herds, Josiah supplied the people with 30,000 lambs and goats for the Passover sacrifice, as well as 3,000 cattle.

His <st data-num="08269" class="">officials</st> also <st data-num="05071" class="">willingly</st> <st data-num="07311" class="">contributed</st> to the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>, <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st>, and <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st>. <st data-num="02518" class="">Hilkiah</st>, <st data-num="02148" class="">Zechariah</st>, and <st data-num="03171" class="">Jehiel</st>, the <st data-num="05057" class="">leaders</st> of <st data-num="0430" class="">God’s</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>, <st data-num="05414">gave</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> <st data-num="0505 08337 03967">2,600</st> <st data-num="06453" class="">Passover sacrifices</st> and <st data-num="07969 03967">300</st> <st data-num="01241" class="">cattle</st>.

<st data-num="03562" class="">Konaniah</st> and his <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st> <st data-num="08098" class="">Shemaiah</st> and <st data-num="05417" class="">Nethanel</st>, along with <st data-num="02811" class="">Hashabiah</st>, <st data-num="03273" class="">Jeiel</st>, and <st data-num="03107" class="">Jozabad</st>, the <st data-num="08269" class="">officials</st> of the <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st>, <st data-num="07311" class="">supplied</st> the <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st> with <st data-num="02568 0505">5,000</st> <st data-num="06453" class="">Passover sacrifices</st> and <st data-num="02568 03967">500</st> <st data-num="01241" class="">cattle</st>.

<st data-num="05656" class="">Preparations</st> were <st data-num="03559" class="">made</st>,<n id="1" /> and the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> <st data-num="05975" class="">stood</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">at</st> their <st data-num="05975" class="">posts</st> and the <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> their <st data-num="04256" class="">divisions</st> as <st data-num="04687" class="">prescribed</st> by the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>.

They <st data-num="07819" class="">slaughtered</st> the <st data-num="06453" class="">Passover lambs</st> and the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> <st data-num="02236" class="">splashed</st> the <st data-num="03027" class="">blood</st>,<n id="1" /> while the <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st> <st data-num="06584" class="">skinned</st> the animals.
They reserved the burnt offerings and the cattle for the family divisions of the people to present to the Lord, as prescribed in the scroll of Moses.

They <st data-num="01310" class="">cooked</st> the <st data-num="06453" class="">Passover sacrifices</st> over the open <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> as <st data-num="04941" class="">prescribed</st> and <st data-num="01310" class="">cooked</st> the <st data-num="06944" class="">consecrated offerings</st> in <st data-num="05518" class="">pots</st>, <st data-num="01731" class="">kettles</st>, and <st data-num="06745" class="">pans</st>. They <st data-num="07323" class="">quickly served</st> them to <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="01121 05971">people</st>.

<st data-num="0310" class="">Afterward</st> they <st data-num="03559" class="">made preparations</st> for <st data-num="01992" class="">themselves</st> and for the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st>, the <st data-num="01121" class="">descendants</st> of <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st>, were <st data-num="05927" class="">offering</st> <st data-num="05930" class="">burnt sacrifices</st> and <st data-num="02459" class="">fat portions</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="03915" class="">evening</st>. The <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st> <st data-num="03559" class="">made preparations</st> for <st data-num="01992" class="">themselves</st> and for the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st>, the <st data-num="01121" class="">descendants</st> of <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st>.

The <st data-num="07891" class="">musicians</st>, the <st data-num="01121" class="">descendants</st> of <st data-num="0623" class="">Asaph</st>, <st data-num="05921" class="">manned</st> their <st data-num="04612" class="">posts</st>, as <st data-num="04687" class="">prescribed</st> by <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>, <st data-num="0623" class="">Asaph</st>, <st data-num="01968" class="">Heman</st>, and <st data-num="03038" class="">Jeduthun</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="02374" class="">prophet</st>.<n id="1" /> The <st data-num="07778" class="">guards</st> at the <st data-num="08179" class="">various</st> <st data-num="08179" class="">gates</st> did <st data-num="0369" class="">not</st> need to <st data-num="05493 05921">leave</st> their <st data-num="05656" class="">posts</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> their <st data-num="0251" class="">fellow</st> <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st> <st data-num="03559" class="">made preparations</st> for them.
So all the preparations for the Lord’s service were made that day, as the Passover was observed and the burnt sacrifices were offered on the altar of the Lord, as prescribed by King Josiah.

So the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> who were <st data-num="04672" class="">present</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">observed</st> the <st data-num="06453" class="">Passover</st> at <st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> <st data-num="06256" class="">time</st>, as well as the <st data-num="02282" class="">Feast</st> of <st data-num="04682" class="">Unleavened Bread</st> for <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st>.

A <st data-num="06453" class="">Passover</st> <st data-num="03644" class="">like</st> this had <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> been <st data-num="06213" class="">observed</st> in <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> since the <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> of <st data-num="08050" class="">Samuel</st> the <st data-num="05030" class="">prophet</st>. <st data-num="03605 03808">None</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">kings</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> had <st data-num="06213" class="">observed</st> a <st data-num="06453" class="">Passover</st> like the <st data-num="0834" class="">one</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">celebrated</st> by <st data-num="02977" class="">Josiah</st>, the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st>, the <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st>, <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the people of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> and <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> who <st data-num="04672" class="">were there</st>, and the <st data-num="03427" class="">residents</st> of <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.
This Passover was observed in the eighteenth year of Josiah’s reign.
After Josiah had done all this for the temple, King Necho of Egypt marched up to do battle at Carchemish on the Euphrates River. Josiah marched out to oppose him.

Necho<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="04397" class="">messengers</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him, <st data-num="0559" class="">saying</st>, “<st data-num="04100" class="">Why</st> are you opposing me, O <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>?<n id="2" /> I am <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">attacking</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">today</st>, <st data-num="03588 0413">but</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">kingdom</st> with which I am at <st data-num="04421" class="">war</st>.<n id="3" /> <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">told</st> me to <st data-num="0926" class="">hurry</st>. <st data-num="02308" class="">Stop</st> opposing <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> is <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> me, or <st data-num="0408" class="">else</st> he will <st data-num="07843" class="">destroy</st> you.”<n id="4" />

But <st data-num="02977" class="">Josiah</st> did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05437" class="">turn</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">back</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> him;<n id="1" /> he <st data-num="02664">disguised</st> himself for <st data-num="03588 03898">battle</st>. He did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="08085 0413">take seriously</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="01697" class="">words</st> of <st data-num="05224" class="">Necho</st> that he had <st data-num="06310" class="">received</st> from <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>; he <st data-num="0935" class="">went</st> to <st data-num="03898" class="">fight</st> him in the <st data-num="01237" class="">Plain</st> of <st data-num="04023" class="">Megiddo</st>.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="03384" class="">Archers</st> <st data-num="03384" class="">shot</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="02977" class="">Josiah</st>; the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">ordered</st> his <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st>, “<st data-num="05674" class="">Take</st> me <st data-num="05674" class="">out</st> of this chariot,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> I am <st data-num="03966" class="">seriously</st> <st data-num="02470" class="">wounded</st>.”

So his <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> <st data-num="05674" class="">took</st> him <st data-num="05674" class="">out</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">of</st> the <st data-num="04818" class="">chariot</st>, <st data-num="07392" class="">put</st> him <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> <st data-num="04932" class="">another</st> <st data-num="07393" class="">chariot</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> he owned, and <st data-num="01980" class="">brought</st> him to <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>,<n id="1" /> where he <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st>. He was <st data-num="06912" class="">buried</st> in the <st data-num="06913" class="">tombs</st> of his <st data-num="01" class="">ancestors</st>;<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the people of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> and <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> <st data-num="056 05921">mourned</st> <st data-num="02977" class="">Josiah</st>.

Jeremiah composed laments for Josiah which all the male and female singers use to mourn Josiah to this very day. It has become customary in Israel to sing these; they are recorded in the Book of Laments.
The rest of the events of Josiah’s reign, including the faithful acts he did in obedience to what is written in the law of the Lord
and his accomplishments, from start to finish, are recorded in the Scroll of the Kings of Israel and Judah.
